content.content: I’m not sure if this should be a “signal request” (seems like that is a forum poll? I’m not interested in that) or what category, sorry about that. I think the original justification for disabling buy-and-burn is losing legitimacy. Without that feedback the system has weaknesses, and buy/burn is at least a good-enough schelling point. On a long timeframe you can abstract any inefficiencies, even auctions that totally misfire, next to other transaction cost of auctions. And it now is becoming a “long time” compared to when it was disabled, I think. Just wanted to have this on record about what I believe is the right design/direction. Maybe if there is interest someone can help facilitate whatever governance stuff has to happen to revert the system to a prior state with correctly balanced incentives.
